definition: old but vigorous (idiom); hale and hearty despite the years

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: I must say again that I heartily admire your gallantry and youthfulness.
sentences.chinese: 我必须再说一遍，我衷心佩服你老当益壮的侠义精神。

sentences.english: How I admire the gallantry of your youthful spirit, Mr. Lorry.
sentences.chinese: 我真佩服你老当益壮的侠义精神，罗瑞先生。

sentences.english: Oh, he's a real spring chicken, always full of energy .
sentences.chinese: 喔，他可真是个老当益壮的人，永远充满活力呢。

definition: treasure knife does not age (idiom); old but still vigorous
lit. a good sword always remains sharp (idiom)/fig. (of one's skills etc) to be as good as ever/the old man still has it
lit. an old steed in the stable still aspires to gallop 1000 miles (idiom); fig. aged person with great aspirations
lit. an old steed in the stable still aspires to gallop 1000 miles (idiom); fig. old people may still cherish high aspirations
pinyin: lao3 ji4 fu2 li4 , zhi4 zai4 qian1 li3

definition: (of one's skills, appearance etc) not to have deteriorated a bit/to be as (good, vigorous etc) as ever
the young will be redoubtable in the years to come (idiom)/the younger generations will surpass us in time
to be in the prime of life
aged/senile
over seventy years old
elderly
devoid of fear (idiom)/intrepid
young and vigorous (idiom)
the prime of one's life
lit. father a lion, son cannot be a dog (honorific); With a distinguished father such as you, the son is sure to do well./like father, like son
lit. heroism reaching to the clouds (idiom)
lit. the rear waves of the Yangtze River drive on those before (idiom)/fig. the new is constantly replacing the old/each new generation excels the previous/(of things) to be constantly evolving
